results.title: Benoit
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Benoit is an astonishingly accomplished eleven year old Quebecois from Joliette. He persues such diverse activities as weight lifting and playing the violin. Member of the Orchestre symphonique des jeunes de Joliette, he still finds time to indulge in a busy life with peers and elders alike. This film moves at Benoit’s pace, which is mostly a fast one. (Awards: Yorkton; Lausanne).

results.title: Benny Hill: Bennies from heaven
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Carter and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This is a compilation of excerpts from the British television program “The Benny Hill Show” during the period 1964-1967. British comedian Benny Hill died in 1992 but is still remembered for his rather wicked schoolboy sense of humour, the sometimes tasteless sexual innuendos and smuttiness in his comedy skits and sketches and the wonderful send-ups from TV game shows and news broadcasts, to film parodies, the Royal family and top Hollywood stars. Included in the cast of many, is Australian singer and entertainer, Patsy Ann Noble. Written by Benny Hill with additional material by Robert Gould. NOTE: Due to the archival nature of this material, the sound and picture quality may vary occasionally.

results.title: Benny & Joon
results.creator_credit: Jerremiah Chechik, Donna Roth, Susan Arnold and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Benny runs a car repair shop and also look after his mentally ill sister, Joon, who tends to create disturbances when left unattended. After Joon suffers a losing night of poker, Benny must also take in Sam, a friend’s cousin, who has his own share of erratic personality traits. Not surprisingly, Sam and Joon immediately hit it off. As they fall deeper in love, Benny must deal with new feelings of jealousy and of not being needed so much by his sister. Cast includes: Johnny Depp, Mary Stuart Masterson, Aidan Quinn, Julianne Moore and Oliver Platt.

results.title: Benji the hunted
results.creator_credit: Joe Camp, Ben Vaughn and Embark
results.brief_description: Benji faces his toughest challenge as he braves the elements after being lost at sea and washed ashore in North America. Benji is responsible for his own survival as well as the litter of orphaned cougar cubs relying on him to guide them to safety. Created and directed by Joe Camp.

results.title: Benji's very own Christmas story
results.brief_description: Another story featuring Benji, the canine star of ‘Benji’ and ‘Benji the hunted’. In this adventure, set during Christmas, Benji ventures to the land of Kris Kringle (Santa Clause) where he discovers a secret that could break the hearts of millions of kids. With Benji’s help however, Kris discovers what real love is all about. Created, produced and directed by Joe Camp.

results.brief_description: The first of the successful series featuring Benji, told from the point of view of the dog. An entertaining movie that will be enjoyed by the whole family. Created, produced and directed by Joe Camp.

results.title: Benjamin Smoke
results.creator_credit: Peter Sillen, Jem Cohen, Pumpernickel, Gravity Hill Films, Cowboy Booking International and C-Hundred Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This American documentary focuses on songwriter, composer and singer, Benjamin (born Robert Dickerson) over the course of ten years as he negotiates the music scene hoping to make a name for himself and maintain the status quo of his life. Benjamin is an underground musician, speed freak, occasional drag queen and HIV+ homosexual man playing punk, fronting the queer-core band Opal Foxx Quartet before forming the blues-oriented band Smoke. Benjamin is from Cabbagetown, Atlanta, home of the go-cart and a mill town where, in Benjamin’s youth, people were poor and drugs and hustlers were in abundance. Extensive interviews with Benjamin are revelatory and deeply personal as he discusses his drug intake, creative urges, sex, gay politics, being HIV+, death and his life’s ambitions. Footage of Benjamin performing live and in the studio shows him to be a talented artist, who sings in a style similar to Tom Waits. This compassionate portrait is quite riveting and fairly down-beat but is also an inspiring chronicle of the human spirit. Jem Cohen and Peter Sillen flesh out the context of Benjamin’s upbringing by examining the social strata of Cabbagetown, an under-ground haven and seedy white-trash neighbourhood before being yuppified in the 1990s. Features a guest appearance by Patti Smith, an artist who inspired Benjamin, and in the bonus footage, a live performance from Chan Marshall, aka Cat Power.

results.title: Benjamin Franklin
results.brief_description: Covers Franklin’s youth, commercial success, experiences in London, and his political career, culminating in his Presidency of the United States of America. No other credits available.

results.title: Benito Cereno
results.brief_description:
In 1799, the Santo Domingo is sailing to Peru, when a slave mutiny erupts on board. Only seven crew members survive, including the Captain, Benito Cereno. The leader of the mutiny, Atimbo, wants to sail back to Africa. When the ship encounters troubles, an American vessel comes to the rescue. Cereno explains that his crew has taken ill with scurvy, including the human cargo imported from Africa. The slaves are down to only a few healthy men and Cereno is awaiting the right

Credits: Director, Serge Roullet ; writer, Serge Roullet ; photography, Ricardo Arronovitch.
Cast: Ruy Guerra, Georges Selmark, Temour Diop, Jacques Mercier, John Turner, Serge Roullet, Philippe Noury.

results.title: Beni Abbes: science in the desert
results.brief_description: Beni Abbes is a Scientific Research Centre, set up in the Sahara by the French. This film shows some of he work being done, in an effort to make the desert fertile once more. Test growing of plants, the use of wind to drive pumps which draw water from below the sand, and an experimental station which aims to harness the sun’s heat to produce power are some of the activities shown.
